title: Test of a Single Variance
body: The FCC conducts broadband speed tests to measure how much data per second passes between a consumer’s computer and the internet. As of August $$2012$$, the standard deviation of internet speeds across internet service providers (ISPs) was $$12.2$$ percent. Suppose a sample of $$15$$ ISPs is taken, and the standard deviation is $$13.2$$. An analyst claims that the standard deviation of speeds is more than what was reported.
